title: Humble beauty
review: Khurpa Tal is located on the way to Nainital Mall road, around 11 km ahead. Many tourists stop here to catch the view. This lake is much smaller than the Nainital lake but has a very calm and soothing effect. However, there is no boating or any activity in the lake.

title: Not a Good Place
review: Why this place is considered as attraction?

title: Beautiful and calming taal
review: Khurpa taal is one with awesomest views....If one is looking for serene pacifying beauty then this taal is a must visit.

title: Away from Nainital's crowded Mall Road
review: Khurpatal should be your preference to stay during the peak season of Summer. Nainital is just 12 KMs away.

title: Quiet place
review: Khurpatal is a place only for those who wish to stay away from hustle and bustle of Nainital and want to spend some quiet moments in the midst of nature. Surrounded by dense vegetation with a beautiful lake nearby, Khurpatal is an ideal getaway. Best for those who just want to stay amidst nature and willing to live without their cell phones for a quiet evenings. Chirping of birds and gentle sounds of streams are all you will hear here.

title: beautiful lake
review: clean and beautiful lake only worth watching from the top. we tried to reach next to it. but its located in residential area. but it looks grt from the top along road. about 9 kms from nainital.

title: Nature's wonder
review: Situated 11km away from city, this lake is nature's wonder. With no exit point the lake gets deeper and deeper every season accumulating all water from the hills.Beautifully surrounded by hills with clouds going past it. There is a small temple just near to it. Not to mention, Jealous of those people with houses just next to it .

title: Nainital lake in centre of city is much better.
review: When you have a good lake right on centre of town and that too much better than Khurpa Taal then what's the use to drive to this place and find nothing better.

title: Lake
review: Good view of the Khurpa Lake from Khurpa Taal point. Stop here to click a couple of photos. One of the many points in Nainital

title: lake
review: known to be a man made lake by people with kurpi. nice location.

title: Khurpa Taal
review: Khurpa Taal is in the Kaladungi Road. It is also pristine and beautiful. On the way to Khurpa Taal is Sariya Taal . The Eco Caves and the waterfall is also on the same route.One can go to Kilbury and Pangot too.It is a beautiful drive and further down is Corbett Museum in Chotta Haldwani.One can do all these places at one go.

title: Nice And Calm
review: Khurpa Taal is a nice lake by the roadside on the backside of nainital. It is hardly 15 -20 minutes drive from Nainital market and can be approached by a nice hilly road with hairpin bends. I went there in winters but I saw some paddle boats lying near the lake, so I think you can do boating there as well in the summer.

title: Khurpa Taal Lake
review: Khurpa Taal is one of the beautiful lake from the Seven lakes those are famouse in UK. Enjoye the Beauty during my visit to Khurpa Taal

title: small lake
review: a beautiful village near the small lake ... looks beautiful ..on the way to nainital from kaldungi side

title: Still wondering
review: A small pond near a village.. over hyped and surely does not need a special visit.. nothing to do except stand there and enjoy the view.

title: Small lake on the outskirts of Nainital
review: Khurpa Tal is a beautiful lake located on the outskirts of Nainital about 11 kms away. The course to Khurpatal is lined with tall trees. Peaceful and scenic, Khurpa Taal is a natural wonder. When the sun is shining and the green lake water glistens under the blue sky, you'll be able to snap really memorable pictures

title: A good view from top
review: We viewed this place from a hill. Offers a good view from the top, with a lake. It's on the way to other points, so you can stop for a few mins along your way.

title: Just another lake
review: One of the many taals in a Nainitaal. There is nothing much at this place.But the view of this lake from Lands End is awesome and it gives a view of Khurpa.

title: enroute are excellent views
review: khurpatal can be seen beautifully from after the bara patthar point. it looks very clean and unlike most spots in india

title: Small lake
review: It is a small lake. Near the nainital. Market is here for shopping. Bargain please otherwise you will became fool.

title: BEAUTIFUL LAKE
review: The viwe of lake is resplendent. It looks like a perfect postcard picture case. Visit was enjoyable. However lot of construction and flats have come up around the Lake, disturbing the ambience

title: Amazing waterfall
review: Only waterfall in Nainital. Amazing for couples and youngsters. After Naini Lake you can spend good time there

title: Very tinny Lake
review: This lake is nothing attractive but it is tinny lake of Nainital. We have seen it from one of the view point on the way to Ramnagar but scenic beauty is good and memorable.

title: A small lake on the hill !!
review: This was somewhat of a let down, specially since the time taken to reach there ! Can be avoided since it’s more of a created attraction more so once you’ve already seen the main Nainital lake  !! Go only if you have the time and inclination. It is better to utilise the time walking/biking/cycling around the Nainital lake !!

title: Small hamlet of scenic beauty
review: Very small hamlet but has excellent scenic beauty... and fresh air,,, away from the rush of Nainital... some small hotels available

title: Royal experience
review: Pleasant weather and beautiful weather for camping.. must visit places with friends and drinks... good

title: Just about good. Good natural views
review: Usual site seeing. Nothing extraordinary

title: beautiful place.
review: It is one of the beautiful places in nainital to visit. the place is very peaceful and best for photography.

title: A view for photos
review: I had a lookout of this lake and just a few good clicks and I was good to go to the next location. The specialty of this lake is that it changes color based on season.This is another view point in Nainithal among the rest.

title: A good view
review: The place comes enroute to naintal and is a small water body which can be seen from the road .The place has nothing much to offer apart from view since there are no water related activities allowed here and more over the water is also not deep and the water body as such is small.Fine though for selfies and pics rest nothing great.

title: Nice view of khurpatal lake
review: We had not visited khurpatal but seen khurpatal lake view point from above.

title: Ok
review: Nothing great about it. It's one of those lakes on the list so we went. Nothing much there could have avoided it.

title: Good stay at Central Govt Holiday home
review: Central Govt. Holiday Home at Khurpa tal has  good and clean rooms. Bathrooms are not so good but ok. Staffs are friendly and get food at reasonable rate on prior ordering. The disadvantage is that it is approximately 10 km from the Nainital city. If you have a hired vehicle with you, it is best option to choose.  I had pleasant stay in holiday home for two days.

title: Just a Lake
review: There is nothing special about this lake except 1 or 2 photo click. 4 to 5 kms. from nainital towards off pangot road this lake offer nothing so extra ordinary.

title: Very poor ... avoid it
review: Very small, filthy, dirty lake in this area. You can avoid this place. I don't have any words to explain.

title: One of the best place to visit just half km from Uttaranchal Restaurant
review: Must visit , wonderful place, safe and full of nature. Called as one of the safest place in Hills with more and more vegetative all across.

title: Nothing amusing
review: I was very hopeful before visiting this place but it is just an ordinary lake. Some makeshift shops are there which serves maggi and corn.

title: A place good to see during day site seeing.
review: Good from aerial view and you can get there by local taxis and buses, they will take you and will stop for sometime as per your request, you can have pictures clicked..

title: Peaceful
review: We stayed here for one night.  it is so just peaceful.  it is a very small village and just two resorts.  but the atmosphere is just pollution free.

title: Liked Khurpa Taal
review: Liked this place more than any place in Nainital. Less noise and very calm and beautiful place with wonderful atmosphere.

title: Included in pakage
review: Lake may be beautiful but we can't able ro saw it from such a great height there is too much fog . This all is included in our 2500-3000 ruppee package that i think is not a great deal .

title: Khurpatal
review: Its one of many lakes near Nainital. If you travelling through Kaladhungi, then it is on the way. Good view

title: Nothing Extra ordinary
review: Nainital itself has one of the best lakes you can see.

title: Very average Lake
review: Very average place. The view from the top might look good but at the view point itself it's not a must visit place.

title: nice place
review: Nice place with an spectacular view, lake changes its colours 7 times in a year, it would have been an good experience to see this but due to shortage of time we left but this is an must vist place.

title: Very Ordinary!!
review: Nothing special about this place, except that you came to Nainital to spend time.  So spend your time to see this ordinary round shaped lake.

title: Sick
review: I was not feeling  well when  I visited  this place so I couldn't  enjoy  the place as well as the beautiful  nature  of this place though  the place has no comparison.

title: One of many, but beautiful nonetheless
review: Part of the lake circuit at Nainital,  this lake is most often viewed from the top. Not a must-see but it's on your way and the view of the valley is lovely. So, no harm in stopping for a click.

title: Nice place in route to Nainital and Mukteshwar
review: This lake is on the way from Delhi to Nainital via kaladhungi..

title: One of the Small lakes around Nainital
review: One of the small lakes around Nainital to spend some time to relax, not a major attraction as such but it is on the way to Nainital you cannot miss.

title: not much for adventurers
review: just a nice skiline, few clicks and thats it.any way it comes in the way of china peak so not a point to miss it.

title: Small lake
review: This lake is on the Nainital - Kaladungi road, just about 25 minutes from High Court area of Mallital. This is a slightly bigger than Saraital, and is further down the road after crossing Sariatal while coming from Nainital. The view from the road is all you can get. Can be skipped if you have already seen Bhimtal, Nani, Naukuchia and other beautiful lakes in the region.

title: Another lake of Nanital
review: Can see lake from nainital which see like Khur of Horse. It is about 10 km from nainital. Beware of taking pics at this palce no entry fees camera allowed.

title: can be given a miss
review: it is a small lake located on Kaladhungi road about 10 km from sukhtal . it is a small lake . the view is spoilt by the many buildings surrounding the lake.

title: Lake
review: Is a small lake on the road to Nainital -- you may want to take pictures and improve your lens-work. One of many lakes that you come across in the region.

title: Fantastic Areal View..
review: Khurpatal is small lake around 10 to 12 km off Nainital on Kaladhungi Road. It has a beautiful areal view. The surroundings have been exploited by constructing housing colonies.. there isn't much activity accepting for general natural walk...

title: A wonderful Valley - Khurpatal
review: On first glance you will definitely fall in love with the view. Mountain ranges surrounds the hotel where we were living in, it was so amazing to wake up in the morning to witness the sunrise as god rays fall upon the mountains and slowly it starts to come down into the valley. The view is so serene and beautiful that you will never want to leave this place. I mean literally you will want to stay there forever.

title: Quite place
review: If you want to enjoy this place and see real beauty I suggest you to choose monsoons.

title: A small but unpolluted lake
review: This is one of the smaller lakes of Nainital district, not much for a lake but full of very clear water so that one can see the rocks below. However, with all the development taking place nearby, it may not remain this way for long.

title: Its Okay
review: Its Khurpa taal which meas color of this lake is changing in year.You can see the different colors but its okay,you can skip this place.

title: photogenic scenary
review: This is again a place good for taking pictures, nothing else to do. The lake is horse-shoe shaped, hence the name.

title: Lake Enhancing The Beauty of Nainital
review: Khurpa Taal is one of the several inland water bodies that adorn the landscape of Nainital.This lake also serve as a water source for locals.It is a Photographers Paradise.

title: Nice view of lake from altitude
review: Covered in the local sight seeing tour, one can click picturesque photographs

title: No attraction just a lake.....
review: Its natural lake of nainital just a lake there are nothing amazing around just hill views. Its outside from nainital main area.

title: Excellent view towards the journey to Nainital...
review: Located on the way to nainital, this is a small tal or lake which can be a place for a very small stopover to relish the taste of natural beauty... One can enjoy tea or maggi enjoying the view of this tal...

title: Another taal
review: Get view of this taal from naintal. Local site seeing covers this place. Be careful while going to this place. Overall view is good

title: Khurpatal
review: One of the first lake which is located just before nainital 18km away

title: One of the many hilltop lakes near Nainital
review: Gets dwarfed amidst the huge Nainital lake

title: Scenic, honeymoon place!
review: Too good views in many angles but no nearby places to explore or visit. Just for a good reboot from mundane life to nature sunrise and sunset.

title: Silent lake
review: A small still and closed lake as there are mountains on three sides and residential area on the fourth. No boating or any other water activities are conducted here though the lake looks amazing due to its location.

title: Visit only if have time
review: One of the places which you will not miss not visiting when in nainital. The local taxi guys will entice you but not required. as it is the lake is shown from quite a distance.

title: Yet another attraction in Nainital
review: We had hired a cab (Alto) to visit 7 different attractions in Nainital, one of which was supposed to be Khurpa tal. However, it turned out to be that we could have only bird's eye view of the same. The cabbie showed us the way to go and have look and waited for us at the road itself. It was just a 20 mins show :)

title: Best place to have a group photo...!!
review: It is one of the lovely places in nainital and it is a must visit place, the scenic beauty of the spot just mesmerises us, the peaks and sal trees adds extra beauty to it, it is a perfect location to take a family group photo, the place is soo clean and tidy, especially all sort of pollution free, overall it's a wonderful place to spend our leisure time..!!!

title: Beautiful Lake
review: This is another lake near Nainital. The view here is also good and you can have a relaxed time over here.

title: Another Lake in City Of Lakes
review: On way to Nainatal. Very peaceful place and offers scenic views. Amazing feel of water bodies. Must visit

title: A vantage view
review: Enroute to Nainital from Kaladungi (and the road is great), one passes Khurpataal.... there is actually no town per se except that it is just below Nainital.... and while driving, the views are great

title: Nice Small Lake
review: This lake is on the way to Nainital if you are going by the Kaladhungi way. Nice small lake surrounded by profound greenery.

title: can vist on way
review: yes no need to go out of your car because its just an ordinary lake you can visit it by going around road beside the lake

title: A lake of different shape .
review: We took a car & went to see the Lake Kurpathal . It is difficult to go near to the lake . one has to sea the beauty fro the road . It is a Worth seeing .

title: Good to visit...just a lake view from top
review: It's ok place. In case your driver is not aware of places and you have space in your vehicle it is suggested to take a guide who are readily available mall road. It's part of the half day tour you can take nothing worth . It is just a view of lake told to be having a shape of cows foot which you can make out as such. It is said that it changes the colour of the water. Secondly the area is under military and one cannot access the lake. Our guide also told that it has crocodiles in it...and our driver was more interested in the crocodiles than the view :).

title: One of the lakes in Nainital
review: Khurpa Taal is one of the many lakes in Nainital. We visited the view point on our way towards Nainital. The lake is located within a valley with mountains all around. It makes a pretty site to visit.

title: boating
review: very interesting place to visit, very cheap , clean

title: nice view
review: its on the way from corbett to nainital, good location for taking snaps and very near to nainital, not very far

title: Not as good as Naini Lake.
review: - This is another lake in Nainital. The lake is not as good Nainital Lake. Boating is not allowed here. Visitors are allowed to see this from particular point.

title: Disappointment
review: Not a must visit in your itinerary for sight seeing. You may drop in from your car if it comes enroute.

title: Lake view
review: A good change from the busy market palace. It has good beauty and normal lake surroundings. Food is their

title: Khurpa tal - a good 5 minute view from the top
review: You cant go down the taal - so its a nice stop over from the top. The chai stop near the taal was good -- it poured when we were there and the hot tea / maggi was a saviour

title: Khurpa Taal - Mesmerising Peaceful natural spot
review: I had visited with my office colleagues. Its a calm and peaceful area surrounding the Lake known as Khurpatal, which is 12Km before Nainital on Ramnagar - Nainital highway. The area is surrounded by villagers of Khurpatal who do farming on the surrounding mountains. We had booked our accommodation in Central Government Holiday Home, which is also a neat & clean property. The food was good at Holiday Home, felt like home. There are no other restaurants except the two which are available in Dynasty Resort and Khurpatal Lake View Resort. One can spend a day out of his official worries in a calm and peaceful environment surrounded by the picturesque natural beauty.

title: very small and dull
review: khurpatal is no more a star attraction, in summer months the lake dries up to a small water body. No need to worry if you give this place a miss.

title: Old memories
review: Been there as a kid (before 1990, not July 2015, as the software forces me to say). Have lovely flahses of memory about riding up to it on a horse, on the day the Great Himalayan Car Rally rested in Nainital.

title: ONE OF THE SEIGHT SEEING
review: Road are nice.View from the roads are beautiful. yo can see the lake from a distance. The shape of the lake is like "Khurpa" that's why it is called Khurpa lake. One thing I must share you can enjoy some awesome "bhutta" with dhaniya chatni & garam Chai there. The taste was awesome.

title: A nice spot for nature lovers.
review: I visited this place on my way to Nainitaal from Corbett National Park. It is a nice spot for a few hours stay. According to our driver, the water of the lake changes with the changes of seasons.

title: Beautiful View
review: A very beautiful lake which you can view from the top on the way to Ramnagar. This lake is not commercialized and I couldn't find tourist there.

title: The Khurpa Taal
review: The Khurpa Taal, translated as the Trowel Lake, is a beautiful lake near Nainital. Usually, it is admired from the roadside while going to Nainital.

title: nice loaction
review: good for nature view. lake view is very nice. location is good for photography. top view of lake is amazing.

title: Peaceful and Serene
review: Sit on the hill and enjoy the lovely view and the pleasant wind blowing in your face. If you just want to enjoy the company of nature and a magnificent view, this is the place.

title: Green Place
review: The khurpa tal is surrounding with lot of serene. It has pleasant view and you can feel peace at khurpa tal. It will give you good experience if you are nature lover.

title: Ethereal
review: Situated at the mountain top its a good ride away from the main mall road of nainital. However the view is absolutely breath taking. Not much else is there than the great breeze and scenic view but that alone makes the most of it.. must see!!

title: peace at its peak
review: The khurpa taal is 11kms far from nainital and if you are a nature lover and looking for some lush greens then must visit the villagers around this place are very nice.

title: Nothing Great
review: We went there and it was just a small lake without any nature or tourism attraction. Naina lake and bheamtal lake are 100 times better than this.

title: Good view point
review: The Krupatal can viewed from top and also its on the way back from Nainital.  From the top it looks beautiful and provides good photo opportunity.  The point from where it can be viewed is a bit slippery because of loose dry sand, one has to be a bit careful otherwise it will be even fatal for selfie lovers.

title: IT IS A PHOTO OP POINT
review: On the way back after halting at the Himalayan View Point, our guide took us to this place.  It is a lake, one of the several in the Nainital area.  It provides a good opportunity for a picture. But in comparison with Bhimtal or Naukuchital, two major lakes, this lake is not that great.  A cup of tea from a stall nearby and watching it from a distance we had our own pleasant moments.

title: Average
review: Khurpa taal lake view is one of the seven point famous point of nainital. This lake view is good for photo session. Good back ground with scenic view. Not very much important but its good to see this taal.

title: Don't call me weird after reading this
review: I found this to be the most beautiful place in whole of Nainital. It intrigued me and that's what I look for in a place. Apparently this lake comes with an amazing story.

title: Atmospheric view of Nainital
review: It is a birds eye view of Nainital while coming down from Himalayan View. One can see the town Nainital from top and lake is very fantastic.

title: Good lake view from top
review: You can have good view from snow point and lake view point. During visit of many famous points, you can see only this lake.

title: Dry in summer
review: The lake was dry when we saw it last week. Our driver told us that the lake has water only in the monsoon.

title: Scenic view
review: Stop by and admire this beautiful place. A twenty minute drive from the city centre, Khurpa Tal is guaranteed to take your breath away.

title: Average
review: One of the small tals here. Not very great and you can take a miss on this. There are better tals to visit.

title: Not a worthy place to visit other than "Dynsty resort" & "Central Govt holiday home" which can give some peace to mind
review: Three words to describe this place: Secluded, lake and a Story.

title: Average place
review: Nice view of Khupa lake from top although not much could be done at the lake itself. The point looks good from the hill top

title: Good Place
review: At 5500 ft its the place with a pond and scenic beauty. Not any thing interesting to see as compare to other places. You can visit this place if you have extra time.

title: Average location (6/10)
review: It is just another tall in Nainital. I viewed at from top. I did not spend much time there. Just few clicks and moved to next location. Local vendors selling tea, maggie, chana etc are there. It has a shape of cow feet so name Khurpa tall. I am adding few pics as well.

title: Awesome view
review: The best way to seethe Khurpa Taal is from a cliff above.  This location is part of seven locations which is offered as a package by taxi operators (Alto cars) from the Mall road itself.  The view point is very informal with the cliff not buttressed with retaining walls, no railing and crazy characters taking selfies at literally the edge of the cliff.  Be careful while getting to the edge and if you are taking children to this location.  The Nainital tourism authority can make this a much better attraction by investing a little bit.

title: Good location to click photos and having coffee.
review: It is just a view of the lake from the top of the hill. You can seat here to relax and enjoy coffee and of course the photo session

title: Amazing View
review: This lake view was just awesome. Can't describe in words. It is suppose to change colors as per the Light it recieves and hence reflects. It is also called The Gupt Lake :)

title: Nothing much to see
review: It's just another lake just like the other bodies of the area. But the only thing that was a bit disappointing was it was too much crowded. Traveling so much to a place with such bustle isn't much of an experience a serene hillside deserves.

title: So so lake
review: If you have been to Nainital or Bhimtal, then you can avoid visiting or sight seeing this place. Place where you  go to see this lake from top is not having any safety wall and measure  at cliff , so dont go if you have kids.

title: Wonderful place to visit
review: Starts with the name of the place , KURPA means Cows foot .Kurpa taal, when you see this taal, it will looks like a cow foot from down side.  wonderful place to visit. though nothing to do much there but to visit  and admire the surroundings. Their is only one nice resort their dynasty resort.

title: Beautiful!!
review: Beautiful lake in between the forests and mountains.

title: Scenic view of lake from the highway
review: Lake heard to have changing colours 6 times every year is surrounded by stepped, hilly landscapes with greens all-round.

title: Waterbody  behind the clouds
review: Little away from Nainital, its a waterbody . We watched it from the Khurpatal view point, the waterbody is much below the view point. Mostly covered under the clouds, you have to wait for clouds to go and watch the talaab from top. The view point itself is a nice place, suggest to visit during sunset to watch the panoramic view.

title: Not good
review: The place is secluded and if u are trying to get away from the city life for some days and just want to relax and do nothing watch birds and listen to the mother nature. Then this place is for you.   Other wise there is not much to see.

title: Peace
review: Khurpa Taal is a small lake near to which Central Govt. Holiday Home is located. There is nothing great about this place.

title: Very Beautiful
review: Khurpa Tal is an amazing lake with amazing views. I have not descended in the valley to go close to Khurpa Tal but have taken its views from various locations in Nainital. The best view of the Khurpa Tal was from Lands End Point. Khurpa tal is named after the hoof ( khur in hindi) of an animal like horse or cow. It is shaped like that.

title: Just another Taal in the city of Taals
review: Three words to describe this place: Secluded, lake and a Story.

title: Another lake ..
review: Nainital area is full of lakes, and one can visit them by taking a lake tour.  Nice view and a day well spent ..

title: just seen from the above was tired if you have visited bhimtaal, nokichiyataal then u would only see khurpa taal from ca
review: ok to visit just to tick that you have visited khurpa taal also with other taals like bhimtaal, nokichiya taal,

title: Central Govt Holiday Home At Khurpa tal
review: Central Govt. Holiday Home at Khurpa tal is very nice, Clean. Being a holiday home you have to order a food to cook in advance. cook is also good. Pleasant stay in holiday home. The only disadvantage is that it is around 10km from Naninital. So if you want to go to market place in Nainital you have to hire a cab which will cost you Rs.300 one way. Holiday home is run by pvt. care taker who is also very nice in nature.  If you call him before reaching he will provide cab for pick-up at extra cost of course .

title: Just another small lake
review: This is just another small lake which is said to change colors naturally.. .but this is a phenomenon that one cannot witness in one visit... so in general it is just another small lake on the way to Nainital.

title: Decent lake in and around Nainital
review: The Khurpa Taal is not as big as the Naini Lake, BhimTaal or NaukuchiaTaal but still worth a visit. It hosts some fun activities like boating.

title: Average place
review: It is a small lake and nothing special to visit. I have cover this point with other places in nainital and spent only 10mins there.

title: Best view place
review: Looks like Khurpa means Iron support to horse legs. Best view from top. Beautiful view if sunny other wise cloudy.

title: Khurpatal- quaint lake
review: Khiurpa tal gets its name as its shaped like a khurpi . You can stop on way to Nainital if you are driving via kaala dungi for a cuppa and take in its serenity  . Clean fresh air hits you as u sit by its die . Fishing with permit used to be allowed here check before you go.

title: Avoid it
review: Another small lake with nice view but frankly its something once can avoid it not much to see here spend around 5 mins here water didn't changed its color guess next time would setup a time lapse

title: Nothing special
review: When you will hire a cab from nainital lake it is just one of the points they count and show otherwise there is nothing special as it is an artificial lake....

title: Good view from top
review: Taal can be viewed from a height which provide excellent views. near to it was Dynasty hotel and Mansa Mata Temple.

title: Nice!
review: According to locals, it changes colour in every season...Pay a visit...Although you cannot reach up to its banks, it'll charm you

title: Just another Mountain Lake
review: We viewed it both from the top of a hill and alongside. No activities here. Just the stillness and colour of the water to be enjoyed.

title: Peaceful view of Nainital
review: It offers you lot many great view point of Nainital.Offers Boat ride and a small waterfall on the way.The journey up till that place itself is refreshing.

title: Small place
review: We drive down to Khurpa Taal as advice by our taxi driver.You can see beautiful seneary of mountain and the lake with crystal clear water.The place is very quit and beautiful with tall trees.I like the place.

title: dnt go
review: it vl b a waste of time dnt go nthn 2 see da water stinks and no1 will be around u n kinda creepy dynasty resort nearby

title: A CALM AND NATURAL PLACE AWAY FROM HUSTLE BUSTLE
review: This is a  calm and natural place far away  from the maddening crowds of the old hill stations.  NOTHING MUCH TO DO AROUND,  just enjoy  THE SILENCE AND THE NATURE.  Not many transportation facilities available, but will surely suggest it you have ur own vehicle to travel around.

title: Hidden lake
review: If you climb towards Nainital from Kaladhungi you will come across a rather hidden lake which from atop gives a distinct green color. The area around the lake is now dotted with cottages. Khurpatal is an off beat location and is best for those who relish the quiet and solitude. Vegetable gardens and beautiful scenery around will refresh you.

title: GREAT VIEW
review: We had a great view of the lake and the panoramic view of its surroundings.... the waters of the lake are still and reflect the sky conditions and seem to look black, blue or green as the case may be.... as shown by the pictures displayed by the taxi driver.... Pic taken by us is attached.

title: Relaxation Point
review: The beauty about the region is natural lakes and Khurpa Taal is one of them, situated on the way to Corbett from Nainital and a pit stop for a long drive.

title: Good One.
review: Worth a visit at least once.The aerial view is fantastic.  Must visit all the lakes. take a day tour.

title: Avoid Local Sightseeing Tour!!
review: The tour package offered by the local guides and taxi operators is not worth it. We paid 1200 bucks for a 2 hour sight seeing but what we saw disappointed me to the core. The places they take you are just simple and i'm sure you must have seen such places in any hill station in India (Lovers point, Snow point, Waterfall, Khurpa taal etc etc). Not worth a single buck. However, you can opt for a cable trolley ride and enjoy the food at restaurants situated on top of the hill (Trolley tickets can be obtained from the counter on Mall Road)

title: Must visit Khurpa Taal, its on your way !
review: Must see, this is on your way to Nainital.  The taal looks like Khurpa which means legs of animal and its purely natural.

title: nice cool place with mesmerizing natural beauty
review: far from nainital hustle bustle, city getting overcrowded,but the weather of khurpatal is little bit much colder than nainital.

title: Great view
review: The 7-points tour available from Nainital takes you to a overhead view of Khurpa Lake. Nice view to spend 10-15 minutes of your time and capture a few selfies.

title: Beautiful!!!
review: just in the centre of the mountains..beautiful location with good resort (DYNASTY)..wonderful weather, nice scenery to admire from the hotel balcony..very peaceful!!!

title: Simple lake view from the top
review: Nothing special to visit, its a nice place to have view of the lake from the top of Nainital. Not worth the value.

title: Not that great
review: Khurpa tal is named after cows feet and it is a small lake, local ppl have made it a tourist spot but nothing much to see at this place, they show it from the peak so the height is good from where it is shown thats it, if you dont have time then you can give this place a miss.

title: Nice lake in the shae of Khur (cow's toe)
review: Nice lake . It has the shape of khur hence called Khupa tal.It is worth visiting . It is one of the attractions of nainital

title: nice place
review: Its a nice lake. But its smaller than naini lake.

title: Alright but not ashtonishing as Nainital
review: You can visit it once. better to view it from top to understand that the shape of the lake. It is situated about 10 km from Nainital.

title: Nothing Great
review: There is absolutely no need for one to see this lake. Watching it far away from nainital is much better. Please avoid.

title: Not The Best...
review: It is a good lake but as compared to other lakes it comes out to be the average one...

title: beautiful and clean
review: I saw this taal from a hieght while enroute to Nainital the green water in the taal was looking good from the hieghts. however some more attraction could have been at this place.

title: beauty tucked away
review: Small yet beautiful lake Khurpatal is beautiful lake some 15 kms from Nainital . This is practically downhill and is close to Mansa devi temple. Clean and neat again serene lake . It has a small maggi point and other eateries around . The lake also has boating facility.

title: khurpa tal
review: The place is ideal for a getaway from the hustle and bustle of the city. If you love peace and solitariness, come and enjoy the beauty of Khurpatal. The place is unexplored by the tourists and modern construction. Till the 19th century AD, Khurpatal was famous for making iron implements but today it more recognized for vegetable farms.

title: Beautiful!
review: What a beauty!! Khurpa Taal is a superb scenic spot about 10 kms from Nainital where you can see a pretty lake right down at the foot of the hill...Naturally layered green patches of beauty !! Go there and enjoy !!

title: SIMPLE
review: A small  lake with a waterfall and surrounding greenerymakes it an additional spot for those who stay for longer periods n Nainital and spend time on trekking. It is about 10kms  from Nainital.

title: Amazing
review: Had we not been forced by our driver to be there at Khurpa taal, we surely would have missed a gem of nature.  Frankly speaking, I have never heard the name of the place before.  It is said that the shape of the lake looks like the hoof (Khur) of the cow and thus it is named as Khurpa taal. Right from the hill, the beautiful lake can be watched and any enthusiastic tourist may move further down.  It is a nice place for posing before the camera too.

title: Small lake
review: Hello, this is on the route to reach Nainital. Its a small lake and also offer boating facility. Its 5 km before reaching Nainital.

title: Avoid Khurpa taal hilltop view. Opt to visit it while descending from Nainital.
review: Nothing great about this location. Your travel guide might tempt you to visit this place and charge you nearly 500 bucks. Bail out.

title: Khurpa taal from top
review: U can view khurpa taal from a hill top which near to suicide point also. View of khurpa taal from top is beautiful. Taal is in shape of a footprint of cow and changes 7 color throughout the year.

title: nothing great
review: We found Naini Lake and Naukuchiyatal very systematic and friendly however other tals/lakes were not that beautiful popular.

title: NOTHING BUT SOMETHING
review: Khurpa tal is a small pond at village Khurpa. Here is hotel Resort also, which is  away from crowded Nainital. If you are in group of 10-15 persons then you can plan to stay here .Morning and Evening may  be very special with a cup of hot tea and some gossips.Tourist taxi shows the aerial view of this point but during visit keep your kids hold  tightly.

title: Changes colour every Hour
review: This was part of our itinery, and what the guide told us was that this lake changes its colour every hour. No one knew how it did, and it remains a mystery ! We saw it green in colour but were told it becomes blue, red black and yellow too !

title: small lake
review: A small lake with excellent view from top.but definetly beatiful and a must during nainital trip.We  may hire a taxi and we can see this enroute and also from top

title: a small lake in nainital
review: This place is actually one of the 7 lakes. This is a very small lake. The beauty of this place is dependent on the weather as too hot weather would make you rush away from the point while foggy weather might not let you see the lakes at all. Best time to visit is early morning or towards evening.

title: A View Point
review: Its a view point from the top, you get to see a small lake. This lake is supposed to change colours every hour, although we couldnt witness it (but we hardly waited for about 10-15 mins).

title: Small lake but good view
review: Khurpa Taal lake is a small lake a few kms from Nainital (around 10kms from Mall road). Though the lake itself is fairly small, the view from the top is beautiful and you can also get a good view of the valley below.

title: awesome...
review: khurpa taal can be best viewed from the upper most point and on the way is a falls which was really nice but very much crowded by tourists...

title: Khurpa tall, less known but worth going
review: It is a less known place. But Naini- Bhimtall and Khurpa Taal are all packed combo if you visit nanital

title: Good place
review: Khurpatal gives a scenic view and refreshing memories. There are 2 resorts. Place has High court complex for families. The lake has a swamp and cautioned not to go nearby. Legend has that lake changes calour frequently. Nearby is Botanical garden and Waterfall. Good trekking routes available. Place is so so...

title: Mirror Mirror!!
review: It is really sad that we cannot go near the lake, you have to see it from up above the hills. You would be left wondering whether it is a  lake or a mirror - you get to see a perfect mirror image of the sky above in the lake..

title: One time visit
review: You should visit the Khurpa tal one time alteast. the view from the road above is 4-5 view points when you travel from kaladungi to nainital.

title: Nature gift...
review: Khurpa Tal, literally Trowel Lake, is an attractive lake about 10 km (6.2 mi) by road (or a 5 km (3.1 mi) hike) from Nainital at an altitude of 1,635 m (5,364 ft). It is popular with anglers and is surrounded by terraced fields (or farms), from which it presumably gets its name.

title: average
review: It was just ok but there is no safety for kids. No railings and nothing special but good for time pass.

title: Small but Beautufull
review: The Khurpa Taal is a small lake but it is simply beautiful. A must visit place for a short time and an ideal spot for few photographs

title: small but nice
review: you might enjoy it but is small , noting much exciting about it although you can visit the botanical garden which is nearby but you  surely need to get the trekking boots

title: lovely view
review: It is really nice place looks really awesome from top you might find it really beautiful from nearby.

title: Lake that changes color....
review: It is situated 9 km from nainital, but the best view you can get of this lake from top of hill,(where your tour guide knows).it  has a beautiful lake and amazing surroundings. the color of Khurpa Tal changes with the changes in color of sky.

title: Beautiful lake..
review: Khurpataal is a small lake but it has amazing colours.. the view from the top is nice and its much more beautiful when ur next to it..

title: A lake with peace and solitariness
review: At an altitude of 5500 ft (1635 MT), this beautiful spot is at a distance of around 10km from Nainital on Kaladhungi road.. It is situated near Saria Tall and Himalayan Botanical Garden.

title: misty view
review: since we went during monsoons, this entire place was covered in mist and seemed a dream sequence from some hindi film!

title: Pond or Lake
review: 16 kms from nainital.. this ia one of lake by time it has lost its beauty but if right efforts are made it can reattain its golden era. one need to make sure a heavy plantation around it

title: Colour changing lake
review: This is colour changing lake and you only believe it after going near it. It is located on Kalaghungi-Nainital road, near Dynasty Resort, so no special visit required. You can see it while going Nainital.  The lake is small, water is clear. But one alarming call is that I have seen so many real estate (construction) work going on just near the lake and this will surely ruin the beauty of Lake.

title: Fantastic lake
review: It is very good and clean lake  i ever seen before and it will change the colour as per the monsoon and climate.

title: Ok - ok
review: There is a lake which changes color .Best time to visit is around March . A village place , overall .

title: Serene natural lake that changes colors
review: We were told a fable that this lake is shaped like a cow's foot and changes its colors every few days. The lake is said to be naturally water-fed and sits amidst beautiful tall mountains.

title: An average Lake, Can visit
review: This lake is quite away from from Nainital which has not much to offer. Again a simple lake(smaller) with same kind of views. Better to cover while coming from Delhi to nainital. Special visit can be avoided & the remaining time can be utilized in visiting other attractions. The view point depends mostly on wheather conditions. We could not see any thing from the view point except enjoying a hot cup of tea.

title: One of the Nice Lake With It's Own Beauty
review: Nice place to Watch. One of the Best Lake among of Nine lakes in Nainitaal. Please Visit The Place. Lake is Too good And Specially Boating Is available.

title: Scenic beauty here is weather dependent.
review: This place is actually a point on the hill where you can see 7 lakes, hence the name. The beauty of this place is dependent on the weather as too hot weather would make you rush away from the point while foggy weather might not let you see the lakes at all. Best time to visit is early morning or towards evening.

title: A lice lake view
review: Though we could not the get the lake view as it was cloudy but i was able to make that this point has a lot to offer. A hot cup of tea, with steaming hot momos and nice corn cobs(Bhutta). This is an ideal place to take a pit stop and get some good pics clicked while having all these things.
